title: List All Files
description: List all files including hidden ones.
subject: SYSTEM_COMMANDS

title: Echo Hello
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a command to read a line from standard input and print it to standard output.

title: Create File
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a command to create a file named 'file.txt' containing the content read from standard input. Then display the file's content.
starterCode:
# Write your command here
cat > file.txt
cat file.txt
hint: Use cat > file.txt and then cat file.txt.

title: Count Lines
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a command to count the number of lines from standard input.

title: First N Lines
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a command to display the first 2 lines from standard input.

title: Last N Lines
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a command to display the last 2 lines from standard input.

title: Sort Lines
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a command to sort the lines from standard input in ascending order.

title: Sort Reverse
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a command to sort the lines from standard input in descending order.

title: Remove Duplicates
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a command to remove adjacent duplicate lines from standard input.

title: Find String
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a command to find lines containing "apple" from standard input.

title: Case Insensitive Search
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a command to find lines containing "Apple" from standard input, ignoring case.

title: Cut Bytes
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a command to extract the first byte from the input.

title: Cut Fields
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a command to extract the second field from input delimited by comma.

title: Translate Characters
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a command to replace all 'a's with 'b's from input.

title: Delete Characters
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a command to delete all digits from input.

title: Reverse String
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a command to reverse the characters of each line of input.

title: Tee Command
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a command to write input to 'f.txt' and also display it to stdout.
starterCode:
# Write your command here
tee f.txt

title: Paste Files
subject: System_Commands
description: Merge lines of 'f1.txt' (content "1") and 'f2.txt' (content "A") side by side.

title: Join Files
subject: System_Commands
description: Join 'f1.txt' ("1 A") and 'f2.txt' ("1 X") on the first field.
setupCode:
echo "1 A" > f1.txt
echo "1 X" > f2.txt

title: Sed Replace
subject: System_Commands
description: Use sed to replace the first occurrence of "a" with "b" in each line of input.

title: Sed Global Replace
subject: System_Commands
description: Use sed to replace all occurrences of "a" with "b" in each line of input.

title: Awk Print Column
subject: System_Commands
description: Use awk to print the second column of input.

title: Awk Sum
subject: System_Commands
description: Use awk to sum the numbers in the first column of input.
starterCode:
# Write your command here
awk '{s+=$1} END {print s}'

title: Find Files
subject: System_Commands
description: Find all files ending with ".txt" in the current directory.

title: Xargs Usage
subject: System_Commands
description: Use xargs to pass input as arguments to echo.
starterCode:
# Write your command here
xargs echo

title: Sequence
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a command to print a sequence of numbers from 1 to the input number.
starterCode:
# Write your command here
xargs seq 1

title: Date Command
subject: System_Commands
description: Print the current date. (Mocked for test).

title: Kernel Name
subject: System_Commands
description: Print the kernel name. (Mocked as Linux).

title: Current User
subject: System_Commands
description: Print the current user. (Mocked as runner).

title: Working Directory
subject: System_Commands
description: Print the current working directory. (Mocked as /app).

title: Make Directory
subject: System_Commands
description: Create a directory named 'd' and list it.
starterCode:
# Write your command here
ls -d d

title: Touch File
subject: System_Commands
starterCode:
# Write your command here
ls f

title: Copy File
subject: System_Commands
starterCode:
# Write your command here
cat b

title: Move File
subject: System_Commands
starterCode:
# Write your command here
cat b

title: Compare Bytes
subject: System_Commands
description: Compare 'a' ("A") and 'b' ("A") byte by byte. No output if identical.

title: Common Lines
subject: System_Commands
description:
Compare sorted files 'a' ("1
2
3") and 'b' ("1
2"). Suppress column 1 and 2 (show only unique to b? No, show unique to a? comm -3 suppresses both unique, shows common. Wait. comm -3 suppresses common? No. comm -12 shows common. comm -3 shows unique to both. Let's use -3 to show diff).
hint: Use comm -3 a b. (Actually comm output depends on flags. -3 suppresses col 3 (common). Wait. -1 suppresses unique to a. -2 suppresses unique to b. -3 suppresses common. So unique to a and unique to b are shown. 3 is unique to a. So it shows in col 1. 1 and 2 are common. So suppressed. Result: 3 in col 1. Tab indentation matters.)

title: Basename
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a command to print the filename from the input path.
starterCode:
# Write your command here
xargs basename

title: Dirname
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a command to print the directory path from the input path.
starterCode:
# Write your command here
xargs dirname

title: Head Bytes
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a command to print the first 2 bytes of input.

title: Tail Bytes
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a command to print the last 2 bytes of input.

title: Fold Lines
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a command to wrap input lines to width 2.

title: Number Lines
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a command to number the lines of input.

title: Octal Dump
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a command to dump input in octal.

title: Strings Command
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a command to print printable characters from input.

title: Shuffle
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a command to shuffle input lines.

title: Factor Numbers
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a command to print prime factors of the input number.
starterCode:
# Write your command here
xargs factor

title: Yes Command
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a command to print the input string twice using yes command.
starterCode:
# Write your command here
xargs yes | head -n 2

title: If Else
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a script that checks if the input string is "A". If yes, print "Yes", else print "No".
starterCode:
# Write your script here
read s
if [ "$s" = "A" ]; then
    echo "Yes"
else
    echo "No"
fi

title: For Loop
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a script to print numbers 1 to the input number using a for loop.
starterCode:
# Write your script here
read n
for ((i=1; i<=n; i++)); do
    echo $i
done

title: While Loop
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a script to print numbers 1 to the input number using a while loop.
starterCode:
# Write your script here
read n
i=1
while [ $i -le $n ]; do
    echo $i
    ((i++))
done

title: Function
subject: System_Commands
description: Define a function 'greet' that prints the argument passed to it. Call it with input.

title: Script Arguments
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a script that prints the first argument passed to it.

title: Case Statement
subject: System_Commands
description: Write a script that reads a fruit name. If "apple", print "Red". If "banana", print "Yellow".

title: Read Input
subject: System_Commands
description: Read a line from stdin and print it.
starterCode:
# Write your script here
read line
echo $line

title: Arithmetic Expansion
subject: System_Commands
description: Read two numbers and print their sum using arithmetic expansion.

title: String Length
subject: System_Commands
description: Read a string and print its length.

title: Substring
subject: System_Commands
description: Read a string and print substring starting at index 1 with length 3.

title: Array Basics
subject: System_Commands
description: Read two words into an array and print the second element.

title: Array Length
subject: System_Commands
description: Read words into an array and print the number of elements.

title: Loop Array
subject: System_Commands
description: Read words into an array and loop through to print each element.
starterCode:
# Write your script here
read -a arr
for i in "${arr[@]}"; do
    echo $i
done

title: Command Substitution
subject: System_Commands
description: Read a string, store it in a variable using command substitution (echo), and print it.
starterCode:
# Write your script here
read s
v=$(echo $s)
echo $v

title: Exit Status
subject: System_Commands
description: Run 'true' or 'false' based on input (0 or 1) and print exit status. (Input 0 -> true, 1 -> false).
starterCode:
# Write your script here
read n
if [ "$n" -eq 0 ]; then true; else false; fi
echo $?

title: File Test
subject: System_Commands
description: Check if 'd' is a directory. Print "Dir" or "No". Assume 'd' exists.
starterCode:
# Write your script here
if [ -d d ]; then echo "Dir"; else echo "No"; fi

title: String Compare
subject: System_Commands
description: Read two strings and check if they are equal. Print "Yes" or "No".
starterCode:
# Write your script here
read a b
if [ "$a" = "$b" ]; then echo "Yes"; else echo "No"; fi

title: Number Compare
subject: System_Commands
description: Read two numbers and check if first is greater than second. Print "Yes" or "No".
starterCode:
# Write your script here
read a b
if [ $a -gt $b ]; then echo "Yes"; else echo "No"; fi

title: Logical AND
subject: System_Commands
description: Read two numbers. Check if both are positive (>0). Print "Yes" or "No".
starterCode:
# Write your script here
read a b
if [ $a -gt 0 ] && [ $b -gt 0 ]; then echo "Yes"; else echo "No"; fi

title: Logical OR
subject: System_Commands
description: Read two numbers. Check if at least one is positive (>0). Print "Yes" or "No".
starterCode:
# Write your script here
read a b
if [ $a -gt 0 ] || [ $b -gt 0 ]; then echo "Yes"; else echo "No"; fi

title: Regex Match
subject: System_Commands
description: Read a string. Check if it starts with "a". Print "Match" or "No".
starterCode:
# Write your script here
read s
if [[ "$s" =~ ^a.* ]]; then echo "Match"; else echo "No"; fi

title: Default Value
subject: System_Commands
description: Read a value. Print it. If empty, print "Def".

title: Here Document
subject: System_Commands
description: Read two lines and print them using heredoc.
starterCode:
# Write your script here
read l1
read l2
cat <<EOF
$l1
$l2
EOF

title: Redirect Stderr
subject: System_Commands
description: Redirect stderr of 'ls nonexist' to stdout. (Output contains "No such file").

examples.output: ls: cannot access 'nonexist': No such file or directory

starterCode:
# Write your script here
ls nonexist 2>&1

testCases.expected: ls: cannot access 'nonexist': No such file or directory

title: Discard Output
subject: System_Commands
description: Read input, echo it, but discard output (print nothing).
starterCode:
# Write your script here
read s
echo $s > /dev/null

title: Brace Expansion
subject: System_Commands
description: Read a string and print it with suffixes 1 and 2 using brace expansion.

title: Process Substitution
subject: System_Commands
description: Read two strings and compare them using diff and process substitution.
starterCode:
# Write your script here
read a b
diff <(echo $a) <(echo $b)

title: Readonly Variable
subject: System_Commands
description: Declare readonly var r="A". Try to change it to input. Print r. (Should print A, error suppressed).
starterCode:
# Write your script here
read val
r="$val" 2>/dev/null
echo $r

title: Unset Variable
subject: System_Commands
description: Read input into 'v', then unset it. Print 'v' (should be empty).
starterCode:
# Write your script here
read v
unset v
echo $v

title: Environment Variable
subject: System_Commands
description: Read input, export it as variable E, and print it.
starterCode:
# Write your script here
read val
export E="$val"
echo $E

title: Basename Suffix
subject: System_Commands
description: Read a filename and remove the .txt suffix.
starterCode:
# Write your script here
read f
basename $f .txt

title: Dirname Path
subject: System_Commands
description: Read a path and print its directory name.
starterCode:
# Write your script here
read p
dirname $p

title: Tr Squeeze
subject: System_Commands
description: Read input and squeeze repeated spaces to single space.

title: Grep Invert
subject: System_Commands
description: Print lines NOT containing "a" in input.

title: Head Tail Pipe
subject: System_Commands
description: Print the 2nd line of input using head and tail.
starterCode:
# Write your script here
head -n 2 | tail -n 1

title: Tee Append
subject: System_Commands
description: Append input to file 'f' (content "A") using tee. Print 'f'.
starterCode:
# Write your script here
tee -a f > /dev/null
cat f

title: Xargs Max Args
subject: System_Commands
description: Pass 1 arg at a time to echo from input.
starterCode:
# Write your script here
xargs -n 1 echo

title: Seq Step
subject: System_Commands
description: Print sequence from 1 to input end with step 2.
starterCode:
# Write your script here
read n
seq 1 2 $n
